reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are a family of 6 and have just had a really pleasant stay. I was a little concerned having read some recent unfavourable reviews but have nothing but praise for the Newby Bridge. The room and linen were clean, pool clean and towels a plenty. The inclusive evening menu is varied and good and the breakfast superb. There is plenty of safe space for the children and finally the staff, although busy, were always helpful. We've just re-booked for August.
reviews.title: A great family weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just needs a major makeover really. Fantastic service and food, but that is about all it has going for it. I stayed for 2 nights with my partner, our bedroom felt very dusty and unclean, damp patches on walls/ceiling as well. The cleaners were lovely people but don't seem to do any dusting or hoovering in the rooms themselves, there was a lamp on the table in our bedroom that looked like it was wearing a wig, the dust was so thick. I had trouble sleeping as it was incredibly warm and stuffy, and the dust was really affecting my chest. Despite the duvet being changed due to dirty marks, the new sheets (although clean and mark-free) still were dust-laden, everytime we turned over in bed a fresh layer was thrown into the air. Not pleasant!
reviews.title: Dated, dusty hotel but lovely staff and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Having said that, if a little time and money was spent cleaning the room, replacing carpets and repapering the walls, the room could've been lovely. Much bigger than some trendy 'boutique' hotels we have stayed in, with a sofa, four poster bed and decent sized closet.
reviews.title: Great staff, lovely food and spacious room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In fairness to the hotel, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and were more than willing to help when we requested a fresh duvet. They acted quickly and without question. The staff in the restaurant were equally as pleasant, and the food was beautiful. Definitely recommend eating in the restaurant if you are staying here. Again the restaurant itself is a bit dated (and the tables a bit sticky!) but the food is brilliant. The leisure facilities are so-so, the pool and jacuzzi were fine - never too busy which was nice. However the mini gym is laughable, and very scruffy looking with the half finished floor.
reviews.title: If we had took the advice of some complainers, we would have missed a very pleasant stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only other positive thing I can think of is the location. We were no more than 25 minutes from any of the places we wanted to visit. Despite this we wouldn't stay here again unless it had a major overhaul.
reviews.title: A disappointing shabby, grubby hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed 3nights for phil,s birthday. rooms spacious, warm and clean, kingsize bed with flatscreen tv on the wall.enjoyed the swimming pool, jacuzzi and steam room, also the bar with its inviting log fire just the job considering the weather.staff very friendly and helpful,food served in the restrauant was exceptional, will most certainly be going back.
reviews.title: jubilee weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We came here for the very reasonably priced sunday dinner which was an all you can eat starter with lots of lovely fresh fish followed by a carvery. The food was excellent, very tasty and obviously fresh. The servie was average, when we arrived we asked to be moved to a different table because we were in the middle of the cramped room (the tables were far too close together) in front of the carvery so we had lots of people passing us to get to the food. We were told that we couldn't be moved as the rest of the empty restaurant had been set up for breakfast the next morning. It wouldn't have taken much effort to let us have one of the breakfast tables but apparently they couldn't be bothered to move us.
reviews.title: Went to the restaurant, good food, average service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from the average service, the food was good and it was good value for money.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at Newby Bridge Hotel and was given a room at the front with 4 poster and jaccusi. The room was pleasant and a comfortable bed enabling a good nights sleep. We had a meal in the restuarant as part of the package and it was splendid and the service excellent. The 2nd night we ate in the bar from the bar menu and found the food brilliant and in a comfortable and cosy area. The breakfast was good, what we liked was the service is quick and a self service with plenty of food. The staff at the hotel were all very pleasant and friendly. The only thing that would have helped is if the hotel could flag up that there is a railway station at Newby Bridge where you can get a train to Lakeside where you pick up the boats for access to Lake Windermere, so you can leave your car at the hotel if you wish. The private railway operates steam trains with old fashioned carriages and was a real treat. All in on a lovely short break.
reviews.title: Enjoyable short break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent accommodation all our needs catered for. A very pleasent stay with friendly & helpfull staff, good sized room and extra large bed. Room cleaned daily and a good variety of Tea, Coffee & Chocolate, extra milk provided and delivered if required. Very pleased with the leisure facilities swimming pool, sauna, jacuzzi and games room all open until at least 8pm. Will return in the future and fully recomendto Families and Couples as a local baseto see thelakes.
reviews.title: Great 2 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very welcoming and helpful staff. Good facilities, nice pool etc. Accommodation getting a little tired in places but updating is in progress. The food was very good, impressive quality and presentation. Especially the evening meal. Lovely breakfast. Very good location for walking and sightseeing in the south lakes area.
reviews.title: Good base for walking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 1 night stay was fantastic!! We were travelling back home when we decided to have one more night to end our holiday break. The four-poster bed was sooooooo comfy---I could have stayed all day! A beautiful bathroom with jaccuzzi bath, all spotless. Our dinner was well presented by a very gracious waitress. The hotel is an old building and well preserved but ,(in my opinion), the guest lounge is in need of a refurbishment. It is comfortable but looking tired. The receptionist on duty was very courteous and helpful. Full marks to all for a delightful stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting with amazing views....................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had our second visit here on a 2 night travel zoo offer. It was excellent value and as usual the staff and food were exceptional. We unfortunately suffered a lack of hot water and heating on the first night. We had a lovely room, Windermere, with great views and four poster bed.
reviews.title: Great value and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made full use of the pool and steam room and would go back without hestitation. The staff are a credit to the hotel and breakfast although very busy was well organised.
reviews.title: Newby Bridge Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and i booked this trip through Travelzoo. We had 4 nights stay on a B&B basis plus 2 nights evening meal with a glass of wine. We were given a room with a Four Poster Bed and a Jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Newby Bridge Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and young daughter stayed at this hotel with friends on 5th & 6th April 2009 and were very disappointed. The carpets were old and dirty, some of the furnishings in the bar area were ripped even the entrance outside was shabby. Our room was very bad, there was a large damp patch on one wall, paper peeling off, holes in the walls, headboards were very dirty with holes in them and fit only for the bin. Generally, the standard was very poor. I complained to reception and the manager came to the room to look at the problems. She agreed with my comments and said she would reduce the room rate. It was reduced by a very small amount but as I explained, my complaint was not about money it was about the hotel being described as something that it wasn't. Dinner was reasonable but not great especially, at the price. The hot food at breakfast ran out with nobody there to replace it. We got fed up waiting and went back to our table. When it did finally arrive, a large queue had formed. Overall, the facilities were there but let down by lack of cleanliness and service. We recently stayed at Jurys Inn, Birmingham, the room was large and spotlessly clean, much more variety of food and much better value even though it had no character. A real shame, this hotel is in a lovely location and could be so much better if only they spent some money on it. On a positive note, our friends' room was much better and the staff were very friendly and doing the best they could under the circumstances.
reviews.title: Expected much more - poor standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just stayed at this hotel for my 50th birthday with friends and had a great time. The rooms were clean and very warm, the staff were excellent and couldn't do enough for you. The three course dinners were very good with plenty of choice and the breakfast was very good. Took my dog and he was treated really well and everybody makes a fuss of the dogs who were all very well behaved. The hotel is in a good position and its easy to get around from there, very near to the steamer so you can leave your car if you want to get to windermere. Would definately recommended this hotel.
reviews.title: After a relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked to stay at the Newby Bridge Hotel, 4th April 2009. We arrived had some lunch, checked in & then asked to leave straight away. The food was rubbish, the hotel is shabby & dirty, & the leisure facilities are a joke! The only recommendation I can give is don't go there in the first place. To be fair to the receptionist, she did handle our complaint well & directed us to a sister hotel, Damson Dean. The Damson Dean is quite good, not worth the money we were charged, but if you can get a decent deal worth going to. But don't go to the Newby Bridge Hotel, you will be disappointed.
reviews.title: Don't book to stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: warm welcome, lovely quiet room overlooking the garden, was offered choice of room, decor a little faded but clean, towels changed daily. food good. excellent staff at reception, bar and dining room, nothing was too much trouble. I lost a handbag which contained no id, this was safely stored until it was returned to me. Enjoyable weekend
reviews.title: lovely hotel with excellent staff and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good value for money
reviews.title: A very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I boked a 2 day break here through superbreaks in October 2008.We were greeted by a lovely friendly receptionist but it was downhill from then on.Our family room was a bit cramped but adaquate and the pool area is wondeful,so relaxing.the first evening for dinner we decided to eat in the bar as it had a nice relaxed atmosphere.the food was overpriced for a bar meal but we were unable to get a table in the restaurant as it was busy.We asked a waiter if we could have the kids meals at the same time as our starters so that they would not have to wait.In fact many restaurants and pubs ask you if you prefer to do this as young kids get hungry and would not necessarily want a starter themselves.Well the waiter brought us our starters,the kids meals and our main courses all at the same time.I asked him to take the main course away until we were ready and he did.One minute later another waiter brought them back and claimed i had asked for all our food at once.The problem here was poor command of the English language.However I speak very clearly as i used to be a teacher of English as a Foreign language.the next day at breakfast they were obviously short staffed and we had to wait 40 minutes for a slice of toast to be brought to our table.This happened again the following morning.We would have complained but there was noone in sight to complain to.We now refer to this hotel as Fawlty towers.to top it all on the way home our 4 year old began to vomit everywhere.Obviously we have no proof that it was due to the food or hygiene at the hotel but it just finished off the holiday nicely !!!!!!You would be better off in a travel Inn or Travelodge!!Also only stay here if you like dogs.The hotel allows dogs and don't you know it...lots of dogs yapping is not my idea of good company.
reviews.title: Terrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent a weekend here to celebrate our parents Golden wedding as it was a half way point between the southern living peopleand the Scots in out group! There was 20 of us including 6 kids, 4 under 5 years old. The staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful. We had several requirements in connection with the celebrations and all were met with a helpful smile and a positive response. From this perspective, it was the perfect venue. I would however agree with some of the comments in previous reviews that the hotel is rather tired and dated and definitely need some money spending on it.. The room was clean and adequate but nothing more. Food was good although the restaurant again is a bit dated. Overall, comfortable clean and excellent staff, reasonably good value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, hotel is dated but comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not an easy hotel to judge. The staff are very helpful and they do truly try to please. Having read the earlier reviews we asked to be shown not only the room we had been originally allocated but a room in one of the annexe/cottages. This was no problem and we chose the annexe room. Good size, dimly lit, four poster, only one chair (that annoys me) and good bathroom. The rest of the hotel looks as though it is stuck in a time warp and needs a good makeover. Faded baronial. It really could be good. The swimming pool and jacuzzi are clean and certainly worth using.
reviews.title: Time warped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is ample food for breakfast - self service with plenty of choice if a tad on the greasy side. The evening meal was okay, the service was good and attentive.
reviews.title: Pay the extra and stay across the road at The Swan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you have a dog - you are very welcome. Plenty of residents brought their dogs, and ate with them in the bar area (not in the restaurant). Remember this is not an expensive hotel. We stayed two nights bead, breakfast and evening meal for just over £200 (as part of a Daily Telegraph deal).
reviews.title: Relaxing Break - Kids were happy so were we!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got this deal from Expedia for 2xx quid for two days of the bank holiday weekend. Hotel appears as a good hotel till you check in. We were put into a very small room that was loft converted. Believe me when i say small you have to keep in mind of your head since you never know when it will be hit by the roof. It is so small that i could never imagine why a hotel would call this a double bed room. The food was not bad and there was no room cleaning service , even had to call the reception to get toilet papers. I would not recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Total Disaster Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Took my mum to the lakes for the 2n b&b and dinner on the first night. We had a lovely time and visited Ambleside, windermere, bowness and more. You need a car but the hotel is in a good position for visiting lots of attractions. We also visited Beatrix potters house which was lovely and i recommend. Our actual room was close to the pool which was handy as we could pop along to see how many people were there before hand and go back to our room to shower afterwards without bumping into anyone! The pool was nice and the jacuzzi lovely and warm. We didnt bother with the steam room. I do agree with others that it the hotel is looking abit tired, but it was clean and and improvements are being made. An extension is being built. This concerned me at first when i saw plastic on the carpet, but once we had passed the area it didnt affect us. Food was lovely. good choice for dinner and breakfast. All staff were helpful and pleasant. Especially our waitress ( short dark hair ) who took some lovely photos for us. Thankyou..
reviews.title: short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on a Friday and Saturday nights and the hotel was quite full. Our room was small but this was offset by a very comfortable four poster bed. The bar was pleasant and the pool was clean. What has made me write this review was the evening meal, it was great. There was only a fixed menu but the presentation and taste of the food was way above expectation. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel
reviews.title: Very good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a Groupon deal for 2 nights last week. When I tried to book initially I was far from impressed as the lady on reception got my booking for the wrong month, so consequently rang me to find out where I was a month early?!
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: She then told me how lucky we were that they had room for my required date but I would have to swap room on the 2nd night. I think after our converstion which ended in me telling her I thought Fawlty Towers was in Torquay she got the message I was far from impressed.
reviews.title: Newby Bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Nights of 9th to 11th June 2012.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at the Newby Bridge Hotel by Jim the Westie.
Didn't even get the chance to stay - Very Unprofessional
reviews.text: Hi, my name is Jim and I’m a West Highland Terrier (a Westie. Me and my “guv”(Norman) have stayed at the Newby Bridge Hotel on a number of occasions and each time we stay it gets better and better. I can confirm that the four poster bed (with lovely white sheets) in room 4 (main part of the hotel) is comfortable since I once jumped on the bed when Norm wasn’t looking to test the mattress. Cant have Norm not having a good nights sleep as it makes him grumpy and he growls at the other guests. The “table dote” “menu is superb. I know this is the fact since Norm allows me to have a taste of his supper as I am lying under the table when he is served dinner in the bar area (the salmon and trout dish this week was fantastic as was the strawberry meringue) . Apologies to the staff for the mess under the table but I’m a bit of a messy eater……but so is Norm. However it was always cleaned up quickly. Cant write a review without mentioning the staff. They all remember me and want to tickle my ears……Norm likes the same but the girls only talk to him. They are always so friendly and pleasant and I wonder how they keep so cheerful under pressure when a coach load of visitors arrive 3 hours earlier than planned. So I give the Newby Bridge Hotel and the staff a 5 “woof “rating. Norman also thinks it’s a great place to stay and we are both looking forward to next years visit.. The Newby Bridge Hotel yet again came up to our expectations as being a dog and human friendly hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recieved a telephone call out of the blue last night informing me that we would not be able to stay at the Newby Bridge hotel because their new extension was still being completed and this is where we would have been staying. I had made the booking for two double rooms back in April via Groupon for my partner's birthday. The plan was for us and another couple to visit the hotel for two nights with dinner on the first night. We were really looking forward to our stay but were contacted (with 9 days to go) by the hotel who informed us that our rooms would not be ready for our stay due to bullding work. We were informed that we could stay at a sister hotel in Kendal. With due respect if I wanted to stay in Kendal (which for the record is very nice - I have family living in the town) I would have booked a hotel there. I was also told that other than that there was nothing else they could do. The tone of the message was very much "couldn't care less". I have also since found out (although I'm sure this is purely coincidental) that this would have been a very busy weekend with various events taking place including the great lake swim. As I said I'm sure that this had nothing to do with our discounted Groupon break being cancelled. I realise that sometimes things happen due to unforeseen circumstances but the way in which the hotel handled things was very unprofessional and was done with a "its not our fault" tone. The four of us had booked time off work far in advance for this trip and as many people will appreciate, time off from hard to come by jobs is very much appreciated in these challenging economic times, so to be treated in such an off hand way was very disappointing indeed.
reviews.title: Old Style English Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Newby Bridge hotel a couple of times, and we have had a lovely relaxing break both times.
reviews.title: Great weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The main feature which drew us to the place was the fact we could enjoy a mini break away in the Lakes and bring along our 2 little amazing pugs. They just love it from the minute we pull up in the car outside, they are spoilt rotten.
reviews.title: Weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: My name is Jim and I’m a West Highland Terrier (a Westie). Me and my owner (Norman) stayed at the Newby Bridge Hotel for 4 nights in June 2009. Whilst the room was great for me Norman commented that the room furnishings were a little dated but he was happy enough that the towels and sheets were clean and the bed was very comfortable. Norman explained to me that the Hotel was of 3 star status and therefore you couldn’t expect 5 star luxury, however from the satisfied sounds that came from Norman when he ate from the main restaurants “table dote” menu (which incidentally was served in the bar area with me sitting alongside him) indicated that he was more than happy with the menu. In fact I heard him say to another guest that the food was definitely of 5 star standard. I (Jim) particularly liked just how friendly and helpful all the staff were with a special mention for the girls on reception. Their early morning cheerfulness always made our day. I will definitely be back for more pampering. Obviously Norman will be back as well. The Newby Bridge Hotel certainly came up to our expectations as being a dog and human friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for dogs and humans.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I (Jim) give it a “5 tail wag rating” for its excellent dog friendly service and environment.
reviews.title: look below the surface

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a birthday party group, 11 of us were accommodated in a delightful private lounge for a generously proportioned afternoon tea. We were made to feel most welcome, home baked cakes and scones were delicious and the sandwiches contained 'real' meat. A fussy vegetarian (sic.) had her needs catered for beautifully and at short notice by staff for whom nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Public rooms and toilets were scrupulously clean. Tripadvisor provides a service to the customer but (Sunday Times 28/6/09/) is vulnerable to manipulation. Look below the surface and give this understated and distinctive hotel a chance to impress the more discerning visitor.
reviews.title: Delightful Stay
The worst hotel I have ever stay, well nearly stayed
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor we were tempted to cancel our stay at the Newby Bridge Hotel but as it had been recommended by friends we decided to give it a try. The staff are very attentive, nothing is to much trouble and you are greeted with a big smile. The rooms are clean, well serviced and perfectly adequate. The food... well where do I start..... was mouth watering, a huge well stocked hot breakfast buffet and the evening menu has something to suit everyone. I would highly recommend this hotel to others as a good base for the Lake District and that fact we could take the dog along with us made it extra special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009
reviews.text: If the hotel offers you one of the outside cottages, please beware! The room was dark, cold, damp (on one of the hottest days of the year so far) smelly, unkempt, dated, dirty and the view was out of this world! Meaning it looked out on the staff caravan park. As we checked in (actually the receptionist was great) we got shown to the room which I had actually been sold at a higher rate as it was a special 4 poster bedroom with a Jacuzzi, we were horrified. Even our dog, who has stayed in some 4 star hotels in the Lakes didn’t want to stay. The smell hit you as soon as you walking in the room, there was a 4 poster bed alright but it looked filthy, I pulled the top cover back and there was a blue sheet underneath that looked very dated and almost mouldy. Also there was a single bed in the room, this had a hole in the side and a very dirty looking duvet cover, no valance or anything to try and make look better! We went out for a walk to discuss what we were going to do. After a while we came back and decided that we didn’t want to stay at this hotel. We asked the receptionist if she could book us into their sister hotel Damson Dene 10 mins away. She called and fortunately they had a room free, it was heaven to arrive at a nice hotel with excellent food after seeing this terrible hotel. Oh yeah, I forgot to say, during our short stay at Newby Bridge Hotel we looked around the building, the swimming pool looked uninviting and dark and oh my god! The GYM, that’s not a gym, it was the entrance to the pool with unfinished floors and disgustingly filthy equipment, I didn’t have my camera at the time to take a picture of just how bad it was. Please, please do not go to this hotel it should be shut down and be made to look like a 3 star hotel that it is suppose to be.
reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
